understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named updateThroughput in the StreamManager class.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is responsible for updating the throughput rate in bytes for streaming file transfers between datacenters. This configuration setting allows users to throttle inter-dc stream throughput.

config_description: Throttles all streaming file transfer between the datacenters, this setting allows users to throttle inter dc stream throughput in addition to throttling all network stream traffic as configured with
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec' is used to throttle all streaming file transfer between the datacenters. It allows users to control the inter DC stream throughput as well as network stream traffic.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the 'setStreamThroughputMbPerSec' method is called to set a new value for the stream throughput. It is also triggered when the 'calculateRateInBytes' method is called to calculate the rate in bytes based on the configured throughput.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec' configuration option is significant as it directly affects the rate at which streaming file transfers occur between datacenters. Setting a lower value can limit the throughput and potentially slow down data transfers, while setting a higher value can increase the throughput but may also lead to network congestion and resource contention.
